Significant flooding were reported due to the overflow of the Seveso River, affecting multiple municipalities, damaging buildings, infrastructure, and urban areas.</p></div></div></div><div data-blockid="n-1Web63" id="n-1Web63" class="jsx-1563605009 float-layout end layout-wrapper is-draggable"><div class="jsx-1563605009 float-wrapper end"><div data-blockid="n-1Web63" class="jsx-bc00cb483410773 "><figure class="jsx-1811446159 jsx-522232890 media-wrapper with-caption"><div class="jsx-1811446159 jsx-522232890 media-wrapper-children remove-line-height"></div><figcaption id="caption-:rb5:" class="jsx-3868162071 caption"><p data-testid="TextInput" class="text-input">Bad weather causes Seveso river to burst its banks in Milan</p></figcaption></figure></div></div></div><div data-blockid="n-GfivFA" id="n-GfivFA" class="jsx-1608645298 layout-wrapper"><div class="jsx-690200300 grid-item-lite"><div data-blockid="n-GfivFA" class="jsx-3921740021 text-viewer"><p data-testid="Paragraph" class="jsx-917930016 jsx-1394512618 medium responsive">The <strong data-testid="CustomText-Bold" class="jsx-5eded4394ab87caf">Seveso River had burst its banks</strong> on Monday, September 22, 2025, flooding the <strong data-testid="CustomText-Bold" class="jsx-5eded4394ab87caf">Niguarda district</strong> in northern Milan after over 200mm of rainfall in a few hours. Despite flood protection measures including retention basins, the massive water volume had overwhelmed the barriers, causing <strong data-testid="CustomText-Bold" class="jsx-5eded4394ab87caf">widespread flooding</strong> in streets, underpasses, and forcing the <strong data-testid="CustomText-Bold" class="jsx-5eded4394ab87caf">evacuation of a school</strong> on Via Valcismon. Fire department had responded to around <strong data-testid="CustomText-Bold" class="jsx-5eded4394ab87caf">75-100 emergency calls</strong> with cars stranded in floodwaters and <strong data-testid="CustomText-Bold" class="jsx-5eded4394ab87caf">power outages</strong> affecting the area (<a target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" data-id="w2S_egK" href="https://en.ilsole24ore.com/art/bad-weather-alert-lombardy-already-80mm-rain-north-milan-AHPDxXlC" class="jsx-772189778 underline-solid"><span contenteditable="false" class="jsx-1f24ab0bc0e7a45f"> </span>en.ilsole24ore.com<span contenteditable="false" class="jsx-1f24ab0bc0e7a45f"> </span></a>)</p></div></div></div><div data-blockid="n-HQeFRr" id="n-HQeFRr" class="jsx-1608645298 layout-wrapper"><div class="jsx-690200300 grid-item-lite"><div data-blockid="n-HQeFRr" class="jsx-3921740021 text-viewer"><p data-testid="Paragraph" class="jsx-917930016 jsx-1394512618 medium responsive">Based on the analysis of 3 remotely-sensed images, Copernicus EMS On-Demand Rapid Mapping estimated that 98.3 ha had been affected in the 2 areas of interest.</p></div></div></div><div data-blockid="n-ID5b1c" id="n-ID5b1c" class="jsx-2839305906 layout-wrapper"><div class="jsx-3611253646 grid-item-lite"><div data-blockid="n-FTZiaO" id="n-FTZiaO" data-testid="Heading" class="jsx-1778256767 heading responsive jsx-2895946300">22/09 - Event start</h3></div></div><div class="jsx-2694072352 description"><div data-blockid="n-2jRYnK" class="jsx-3921740021 text-viewer"><p data-testid="Paragraph" class="jsx-917930016 jsx-1394512618 medium responsive"><strong data-testid="CustomText-Bold" class="jsx-5eded4394ab87caf">Severe autumn storms</strong> hit northwestern Italy on September 22, 2025, prompting an <strong data-testid="CustomText-Bold" class="jsx-5eded4394ab87caf">orange weather alert</strong> for Lombardy and Liguria regions. In Milan, torrential rains caused the <strong data-testid="CustomText-Bold" class="jsx-5eded4394ab87caf">Seveso River to overflow</strong>, flooding northern neighborhoods after 30mm of rain fell by dawn and over 80mm in Paderno Dugnano. (<a target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" data-id="MP1bXtR" href="https://www.gazetaexpress.com/en/Bad-weather-hits-northern-Italy--storms-and-floods-in-Milan/" class="jsx-772189778 underline-solid"><span contenteditable="false" class="jsx-1f24ab0bc0e7a45f"> </span>Gazeta Express<span contenteditable="false" class="jsx-1f24ab0bc0e7a45f"> </span></a>)</p></div></div><span class="jsx-2694072352 circle"></span></div></div></div></div></div><div data-blockid="n-Cmmn8j" id="n-Cmmn8j" class="jsx-1050596338 layout-wrapper draggable"><div class="jsx-2694072352 single-side"><div class="jsx-1646993261 grid-container"><div aria-hidden="true" class="jsx-3926443229 white-space-item"></div><div class="jsx-4169904184 grid-item"><div class="jsx-2694072352 content"><div class="jsx-2694072352 title"><div data-blockid="n-pZchTp" class="jsx-3921740021 text-viewer"><h3 id=":rbg:" data-testid="Heading" class="jsx-1778256767 heading responsive jsx-2895946300">22/09 (14:42 UTC) - Activation start</h3></div></div><div class="jsx-2694072352 description"><div data-blockid="n-iKzBNk" class="jsx-3921740021 text-viewer"><p data-testid="Paragraph" class="jsx-917930016 jsx-1394512618 medium responsive">On the 22/09/2025 at 14:42 UTC, Presidency of the Council of Ministers - Italian Department of Civil Protection triggered Copernicus EMS On-Demand Rapid Mapping service to cover the flood event in Milan city. Despite flood protection measures including retention basins, the massive water volume had overwhelmed the barriers, causing\u003cstrong\u003ewidespread flooding\u003c/strong\u003ein streets, underpasses, and forcing the\u003cstrong\u003eevacuation of a school\u003c/strong\u003eon Via Valcismon. Fire department had responded to around\u003cstrong\u003e75-100 emergency calls\u003c/strong\u003ewith cars stranded in floodwaters and\u003cstrong\u003epower outages\u003c/strong\u003eaffecting the area (\u003ca href=\"https://en.ilsole24ore.com/art/bad-weather-alert-lombardy-already-80mm-rain-north-milan-AHPDxXlC\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003een.ilsole24ore.com\u003c/a\u003e)","type":"paragraph"}},"n-HQeFRr":{"type":"text","data":{"text":"Based on the analysis of 3 remotely-sensed images, Copernicus EMS On-Demand Rapid Mapping estimated that 98.3 ha had been affected in the 2 areas of interest.","type":"paragraph"}},"n-rfQPXh":{"type":"image","data":{"image":"r-tAADLH"}},"n-NpaYMw":{"type":"text","data":{"text":"Flood warning","type":"h3"},"config":{"size":"wide"}},"n-nLZbQX":{"type":"text","data":{"text":"Due to rain starting on 22/09, \u003ca href=\"https://www.copernicus.eu/en/european-flood-awareness-system\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eflooding was forecast\u003c/a\u003eto affect Po Basin. fit_html:
Skip to content

Flood in Italy

EMSR843 - Situational reporting

Copernicus Emergency Management Service (CEMS)

  1. Activation
  2. Exposure
  3. Emergency mapping
  4. Media coverage
  5. Additional information

The situational reporting aims to provide a live and synthetic overview of the event and the on-demand emergency mapping conducted by Copernicus EMS.

Activation

On 22 September 2025 at the early hours of the morning, a severe storm was reported to have affected northern Italy, particularly the Lombardy region, including the city of Milan and its surroundings. Significant flooding were reported due to the overflow of the Seveso River, affecting multiple municipalities, damaging buildings, infrastructure, and urban areas.

TheSeveso River had burst its bankson Monday, September 22, 2025, flooding theNiguarda districtin northern Milan after over 200mm of rainfall in a few hours. Despite flood protection measures including retention basins, the massive water volume had overwhelmed the barriers, causingwidespread floodingin streets, underpasses, and forcing theevacuation of a schoolon Via Valcismon. Fire department had responded to around75-100 emergency callswith cars stranded in floodwaters andpower outagesaffecting the area (en.ilsole24ore.com)

Based on the analysis of 3 remotely-sensed images, Copernicus EMS On-Demand Rapid Mapping estimated that 98.3 ha had been affected in the 2 areas of interest.

Flood warning

Due to rain starting on 22/09, to affect Po Basin. Indeed, according to the European Flood Awareness System (), there was a high risk within this area.

22/09 - Event start

Severe autumn stormshit northwestern Italy on September 22, 2025, prompting anorange weather alertfor Lombardy and Liguria regions. In Milan, torrential rains caused theSeveso River to overflow, flooding northern neighborhoods after 30mm of rain fell by dawn and over 80mm in Paderno Dugnano.()

22/09 (14:42 UTC) - Activation start

On the 22/09/2025 at 14:42 UTC, Presidency of the Council of Ministers - Italian Department of Civil Protection triggered Copernicus EMS On-Demand Rapid Mapping service to cover the flood event in Milan city. Copernicus EMS Rapid Mapping was requested to provide flood extent and damage assessment emergency mapping ().

30/09 - Closure of the activation

No additional products are planned. The activation is closed.

Live production status

Back to top

Exposure

Emergency mapping

Observed impact

Latest situation

EMSR843 - Latest situation overview

The graph illustrates the impact of the event, the distribution of the affected natural land use and its evolution.

AOI01 - Seveso - Cumulative analysis

AOI02 - Blevio - Cumulative analysis

This map shows the evolution of the damage assessment on built-up, allowing for a cumulative analysis.

The map below allows comparing a crisis Geoeye-1 image against a reference base image. It was taken on 24 September 2025 10:35 UTC over Blevio (AOI02) and provides a visual analysis of changes and impacts before and after the flood.

Details and download

Media coverage

No media coverage was included, and the activation is now closed.

Additional information

Copernicus Emergency Management Service (Credit: 2025 European Union)

Learn more about theand its.

Disclaimer: The content on this page is the sole responsibility of the CEMS On-demand mapping service providers. The texts reflect solely the views of their authors and can in no way be taken to reflect the views of the European Commission.

On 22 September 2025 at the early hours of the morning, a severe storm was reported to have affected northern Italy, particularly the Lombardy region, including the city of Milan and its surroundings. Significant flooding were reported due to the overflow of the Seveso River, affecting multiple municipalities, damaging buildings, infrastructure, and urban areas.
Bad weather causes Seveso river to burst its banks in Milan
The **Seveso River had burst its banks** on Monday, September 22, 2025, flooding the **Niguarda district** in northern Milan after over 200mm of rainfall in a few hours. Despite flood protection measures including retention basins, the massive water volume had overwhelmed the barriers, causing **widespread flooding** in streets, underpasses, and forcing the **evacuation of a school** on Via Valcismon. Fire department had responded to around **75-100 emergency calls** with cars stranded in floodwaters and **power outages** affecting the area ([](https://en.ilsole24ore.com/art/bad-weather-alert-lombardy-already-80mm-rain-north-milan-AHPDxXlC))
Based on the analysis of 3 remotely-sensed images, Copernicus EMS On-Demand Rapid Mapping estimated that 98.3 ha had been affected in the 2 areas of interest.
### Flood warning
Due to rain starting on 22/09, [](https://www.copernicus.eu/en/european-flood-awareness-system)to affect Po Basin. Indeed, according to the European Flood Awareness System ([](https://european-flood.emergency.copernicus.eu/en)), there was a high risk within this area.
[](https://www.gazetaexpress.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/2-2.png)
### 22/09 - Event start
**Severe autumn storms** hit northwestern Italy on September 22, 2025, prompting an **orange weather alert** for Lombardy and Liguria regions. In Milan, torrential rains caused the **Seveso River to overflow** , flooding northern neighborhoods after 30mm of rain fell by dawn and over 80mm in Paderno Dugnano. ([](https://www.gazetaexpress.com/en/Bad-weather-hits-northern-Italy--storms-and-floods-in-Milan/))
### 22/09 (14:42 UTC) - Activation start
On the 22/09/2025 at 14:42 UTC, Presidency of the Council of Ministers - Italian Department of Civil Protection triggered Copernicus EMS On-Demand Rapid Mapping service to cover the flood event in Milan city. Copernicus EMS Rapid Mapping was requested to provide flood extent and damage assessment emergency mapping ([](https://rapidmapping.emergency.copernicus.eu/EMSR843/download)).
### 30/09 - Closure of the activation
No additional products are planned. The activation is closed.

# Flood in Italy
EMSR843 - Situational reporting
Copernicus Emergency Management Service (CEMS)
![](blob:https://storymaps.arcgis.com/7521cb66-8736-4e35-8700-c9e27d325462)
  1. Activation3
  2. Exposure4
  3. Emergency mapping5
  4. Media coverage6
  5. Additional information7


The situational reporting aims to provide a live and synthetic overview of the event and the on-demand emergency mapping conducted by Copernicus EMS.
## Activation
Expand
Unable to display map. WebGL2 support is required.
Ensure that your browser and hardware meet the minimum requirements.
<https://esriurl.com/webgl-faq>
On 22 September 2025 at the early hours of the morning, a severe storm was reported to have affected northern Italy, particularly the Lombardy region, including the city of Milan and its surroundings. Significant flooding were reported due to the overflow of the Seveso River, affecting multiple municipalities, damaging buildings, infrastructure, and urban areas.
Bad weather causes Seveso river to burst its banks in Milan
The **Seveso River had burst its banks** on Monday, September 22, 2025, flooding the **Niguarda district** in northern Milan after over 200mm of rainfall in a few hours. Despite flood protection measures including retention basins, the massive water volume had overwhelmed the barriers, causing **widespread flooding** in streets, underpasses, and forcing the **evacuation of a school** on Via Valcismon. Fire department had responded to around **75-100 emergency calls** with cars stranded in floodwaters and **power outages** affecting the area ([](https://en.ilsole24ore.com/art/bad-weather-alert-lombardy-already-80mm-rain-north-milan-AHPDxXlC))
Based on the analysis of 3 remotely-sensed images, Copernicus EMS On-Demand Rapid Mapping estimated that 98.3 ha had been affected in the 2 areas of interest.
### Flood warning
Due to rain starting on 22/09, [](https://www.copernicus.eu/en/european-flood-awareness-system)to affect Po Basin. Indeed, according to the European Flood Awareness System ([](https://european-flood.emergency.copernicus.eu/en)), there was a high risk within this area.
[](https://www.gazetaexpress.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/2-2.png)
### 22/09 - Event start
**Severe autumn storms** hit northwestern Italy on September 22, 2025, prompting an **orange weather alert** for Lombardy and Liguria regions. In Milan, torrential rains caused the **Seveso River to overflow** , flooding northern neighborhoods after 30mm of rain fell by dawn and over 80mm in Paderno Dugnano. ([](https://www.gazetaexpress.com/en/Bad-weather-hits-northern-Italy--storms-and-floods-in-Milan/))
### 22/09 (14:42 UTC) - Activation start
On the 22/09/2025 at 14:42 UTC, Presidency of the Council of Ministers - Italian Department of Civil Protection triggered Copernicus EMS On-Demand Rapid Mapping service to cover the flood event in Milan city. Copernicus EMS Rapid Mapping was requested to provide flood extent and damage assessment emergency mapping ([](https://rapidmapping.emergency.copernicus.eu/EMSR843/download)).
### 30/09 - Closure of the activation
No additional products are planned. The activation is closed.
**AOI ID** | **Name** | **Emergency products delivered** | **New emergency products planned**  
---|---|---|---  
01 | Seveso | 2 | No  
02 | Blevio | 1 | No
